Key:
(Oogh. I ran up so many steps today, so my thighs and calves
 are super sore, but... I have so many dates to go on.)
(Alright, I'll have us hang out at home then.)

Hey Tohka? We still have some time until dinner,
so do you want to kill some time by playing games?

Hm? Ohhh, that beep boop-ing thing that Kotori often does!
If you wish to play, Shido, then I will as well!
Okay, then do you want to battle?
Yes, bring it on!
Then here Tohka, use this controller.
Hm, this one, yes?

Alright, let's start with practice first.
I've done it before so I know, but this is your first time, right Tohka?

Hmph! No, that's not so.
I've played it before with Kotori, when she was on break.
Huh!? I-Is that so?
Yes, so any time is fine. Bring it on, Shido!

Alright, then that makes things faster!
It's too early to win against me, you know?
Hmm! I'll take you on!
My character is Kazuma, the master of Jyukkokuken!
Oh?
Who do you use, Tohka?
Hm, I can win with this one!

(The character that Tohka selected is a magician called
Pandabear," and as the name suggests, it's a straightforward

Operator: cross between a bear and a panda.)"

Key:
(The hyper-realistically drawn, malicious-looking panda's face
has red eyes that gleam from underneath its formal robe and hood.)

(The hands sticking out of either sleeves are as rough as a bear's,
and covered in bristly brown hair. Lastly, in his hand was a giant
staff inlaid with red jewels.)
(No matter how anybody looks at him, he's more scary than cute, right...?)
H-Hey Tohka. Can I ask you one thing?
Hm, what is it?

W-Why did you pick that character out of everything else?
Weren't there cuter, or cooler-looking ones?

Hrm! Do you not know his story, Shido?
He's a magician, and when he wins against an opponent,
he changes them into his favorite food and eats them!
...A-Ahh, I see.

(...I suppose in a way, it's a very Tohka-like choice.
...Nobody uses that character, so I completely forgot.)

Now then! Today, I will change you into a hamburg steak
with plenty of demi-glace sauce!
――No, wait...ponzu with radish is also quite good!

(C-Can you choose dishes with all those ingredients?
Where did this game invest all its resources...??)

...A-Anyway, just try to win.
If you don't win against me, you won't be able to see
the victory screen, after all.
Yes, I know. Come at me from any angle!

――Gah!
Who would use their special attack at this timing!?
What's wrong Shido! Even Kotori was better!

(...This is bad. Tohka's been unwittingly trained by Kotori!
If I go easy on her here, I'm in big trouble...)

(No, wait a minute!
If I fought honestly and Tohka's mood was worsened,
worst-case scenario, she could possibly rampage...?)

(No no, wait wait!
If she finds out she didn't win fair and square,
conversely wouldn't she get angry?)

Shido! What are you spacing out for?
There is no need to go easy on me!
――Urgh!
(While I was thinking she got in a really good one!)
(Alright! I've made up my mind! With Tohka, I'll――)
Fight with her seriously.
Give her some slack while fighting.

(I'll fight Tohka seriously!
This is Tohka, if I went easy on her...
She'd easily see through it and get angry.)

(If I do things seriously, and I end up winning fair and square,
if that's the outcome of the match, then Tohka's sure to accept it!)

Not yet! It's not over yet!
Tohka! This is where it really begins! Let's go!
Hrm!? Come at me, Shidooooooo!
N-No way...it can't be...!
Ohhh! You're delicious-looking Shido! So much cheese!

(...I-It's impossible.
In the first place, cooking a human and eating them
is totally wrong for a kid-oriented game...)

Hmm, you seem quite stunned Shido.
Perhaps you lack the practice to go up against me?
Y-Yeah...it's true that I haven't played recently...
Hrm...it's no good. Staring at the screen is making me hungry.
I-It's almost dinner, after all...let's end here for today.

Yes. If you wish to battle me again, just ask anytime.
Oh! That's right!
Next time, I will make you into ankake fried rice!
...I'll practice.

(No, I should go easy on her.
 If I fought her seriously, and Tohka gets completely knocked out,
 I have no idea what'll happen to Tohka's mood...)

(Besides, this is technically a date, so if that's the case,
 so I should think the top priority is making Tohka happy.)
Y-You're good Tohka! Your powerful attacks are amazing!

Shido! This is not all of my power!
Soon I will make you into a juicy hamburg steak!

Whoah!? What is that attack!?
I can't dodge!

(I pretended not to know her special attack,
 and intentionally made a small hop into taking it head-on.
 With this, I lose.)
A-Are you serious...! It takes that much off your health at once!?

Shido, that attack...
Didn't you already know you could dodge that with emergency evasion?
Er...Well, it's been so long, I didn't remember.

...I thought this was a serious match, but I am quite disappointed, Shido...
You were going easy on me, weren't you?
T-Tohka!? W-What's the matter?

Shido...If you are to battle me, I wish you would do so seriously.
No matter the reason, being decieved by you...
Well, it makes me very sad...
...! ...I-I'm sorry.
Hrm...it's no good. Staring at the screen is making me hungry.
I-It's almost dinner, after all...let's end here for today.

Hm. Hey, Shido...the next time we battle,
I request that it'll be all in," okay?"
R-Right. Next time, it'll be a serious match!

Yes! If I win next time, what should I change you into next?
Should it be ankake fried rice?
Or maybe, gomoku fried rice?

...I guess either way it's decided I'm going to become fried rice.
Hrrmmm...
――I wouldn't want either...yeah.
